title: How Many Calories in an Ounce of Vodka?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in an ounce of vodka, including alcohol content, zero carbs or protein, and tips for mixes or variations.
h1: How Many Calories in an Ounce of Vodka?
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) distilled vodka, unflavored, no additives; 1 fl oz ≈ 30 ml serving.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, brand, and dilution; mixers add extra calories. Consult labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One ounce of 80-proof vodka contains about 64 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts for distilled spirits, showing empty calories from ethanol.

tweaks.label: Mix with 4 oz diet soda (zero-cal mixer)
Add 1 oz simple syrup (for flavored shot)

faqs.q: How many calories in an ounce of vodka?
Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No—pure vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~16 kcal per ounce vs. 80-proof.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka besides calories?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, or micronutrients; it's essentially empty calories.

faqs.q: What about calories in vodka mixers?
faqs.a: Vodka alone is 64 kcal/oz, but tonic or juice can double or triple totals—opt for zero-cal mixers.
